messages.message:
Hey all.. As part of the Central Observability project (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pG5SGpn8QB6DV-ndtJ1BYzppCUyL4-rjc08JT9ELemw/edit?pli=1), the Observability team is trying to centralize the logs to a single region. But some of the services currently log user PII data and customer inputs into the logs and it's a blocker. Team needs help with the service owners to scrub the logs to clear customer data.  @Rakesh @Anil @andy @lydia @Balaram Can you all pls help assign some reps from your teams who can help with respective services/components? cc: @HH

Meanwhile @HH can you also list some examples or any analysis that you have done that captures PII data in logs?
langchain logging whole OpenAI prompts would be one for sure.

thank you @Hari for the help. I will get a list of attributes which needs to be removed or similar attributes from logs.

@Sławek Biel yes, prompts would be one.
Will we still collect these logs and just not store them in the centralized location? These logs with PII are often critical for debugging

No, we won't be collecting customer data in logs. Our goal is to ensure logs can be centralized without compromising customer data. Would those data logged during debug mode or in regular logging?

We can evaluate this on a case-by-case basis to determine if any specific data is critical for debugging.
How would we access logs under debug mode? Would we only see them if we set debug mode temporarily?
Yes, we would set the debug temporarily only.  We can come with the work around for temporary case.
